meanings.definition: The state or property of being isotonic.
meanings.sent1: The isotonicity of the solution allowed for easy movement of water.
meanings.sent2: The isotonicity of the cells ensured a balanced environment.
meanings.sent3: The isotonicity of the sports drink made it perfect for rehydration after exercise.
meanings.sent4: The isotonicity of the relationship between the two countries prevented any conflicts.
meanings.sent5: The isotonicity of the lake water made it safe for swimming.

meanings.definition: The quality of having equal osmotic pressure.
meanings.sent1: The isotonicity of the solutions on both sides of the membrane kept the pressure balanced.
meanings.sent2: The isotonicity of the blood cells allowed for proper nutrient exchange.
meanings.sent3: The isotonicity of the cola and lemonade mix created a fizzy explosion.
meanings.sent4: The isotonicity of the negotiation process ensured a fair outcome for all parties.
meanings.sent5: The isotonicity of the plant cells helped maintain their structure and function.
